page.title: 13Village Wartime Memories.
page.content: 'George' Burgess remembers with pride the A.R.P.warden plaque on his gate at West Stour.He recalls the day the London evacuees arrived,primary age children with two teachers.Their lessons were held in the schoolroom of Ashley House and in the village school which by then was the village hall.His daughter tells of the year when a Christmas present from the Sunday School was a gas mask case. Memories too of Italian prisoners of war living in two cottages in the village and working at Manor Farm. The village green has a momento of the first world war, a large shell lying on its side. George recalls how it was taken away in the second world war, along with some iron railings, to be used as scrap metal to help the war effort.
